node.text: Value carts only, no refunds, ever. You want a proper cart, then go to a... oh, I don't know, some proper cart maker! My carts are good enough and when they break, you come here and buy another.

option.optiontext: I don't need a cart, could use a few coins for honest work though.

node.text: Hmm, I don't like the sound of losing coin... but I could use some more wood for my carts. Alright then, you want work? Chop some five logs of spruce for me and I'll pay you - minimum rates only!
Well good, there's spruce in the woods aplenty. You'll need a hatchet though and I ain't got one for you to spare, so you need to get your own. I'll need five logs minimum!

option.actions: SetVar=Grainwatercart-1,NpcChat=I don't like losing coin> but could really use more spruce for my carts.

node.text: You looking for a cart? Value carts, no refunds, don't wanna hear complaints either... wait, you're the fellow I sent to work, aren't you?

option.optiontext: You asked me for logs of spruce, and I bring you some.
I forget, what did you ask of me?

node.text: You been hit in the head or something? I asked you to bring me more spruce for my carts, five logs. And I ain't paying anything other than minimum rates for the wood either.
Woods are full of spruce. You'll need your own hatchet, ain't got one for you. If the work's not to your liking, then tough - won't be any pay either!
These logs aren't of very high quality... but whatever, I'll set my lazy husband to work on these when I find him. Thank you, you can go now.
Suppose you want some coin then, do you? Honestly, your logs are barely worth anything... But fine, guess we agreed on some payment. And don't be asking for more now, because this is all you'll get!

option.actions: AddItems=131-25-true,SetVar=Grainwatercart-3,RemoveItems=61-5,NpcChat=You can see yourself out now> I have customers waiting...

node.text: Greetings, traveler! What brings you to Barnsmill Estate?

option.optiontext: I’m looking for work. Do you have anything I can help with?
I’ve brought the barley you asked for.
Can you remind me what I need to do?
I’m well, hope you are too!

node.text: Well, I could use some help gathering barley. I should probably ask Barney if it’s alright to get outside help, but... I don’t see why not. Could you fetch some for me?
You should be able to gather five bundles of barley from the fields there.

option.optiontext: I’ll bring it back for you.

node.text: Thank you, traveler. This will help a lot!
The harvest is going well, thanks to the extra hands.
Greetings! If yer lookin' to chop some wood, grab yerself a hatchet!

option.optiontext: Thanks, I’ll keep that in mind.

node.text: Welcome, traveler. How may I assist you today at the Haywind College library?

option.optiontext: I’m a traveler looking for work. Do you need anything?
I’ve brought the two books you requested.
Remind me, what did you need again?

node.text: I need two rare books for the college’s collection. They’ve arrived from a distant land and are with Marissa at the general store. These books are vital to our studies, so are you sure you can handle this task?
Thank you for retrieving the books, traveler. They’ll be a great addition to our collection.
Greetings, traveler! You must be the mayor's errand boy, right? Here to run some more tasks, I assume?

option.optiontext: Who am I delivering this letter to again?

node.text: I’m trying to get an audience with the mayor to start my business, but apparently, he's is ‘too busy’. Take this letter to the market square vegetable vendor for me?

option.optiontext: Certainly, I’ll take care of it.

node.text: Business? Of course, it’ll flourish once I finally get things going. The mayor should be grateful someone as capable as me is bringing prosperity to Haywind.
Ah, there you are! Took you long enough. The militia said they were sending someone to assist me. You’re here for the scouting mission, right?

option.optiontext: Actually, no, but I can help if you need it.
What was it you needed again?
Anything new with the mercenary camp?

node.text: Not the one they sent, huh? Well, if you're offering, I won't turn down help. Scout the mercenary camp to the south and see what they’re up to. I’d go myself, but they know me too well.
So, what did you see?

option.optiontext: They seem to be preparing for something big.
Nothing out of the ordinary, just their usual business.

node.text: Nothing suspicious, huh? Well, keep an eye on them. If anything changes, let me know.
Good work. If they’re gearing up for something, we’ll need to be prepared. Thanks for the intel.
No updates from the mercenary camp yet. Stay sharp.
Oi, you! Another one of these slackers, eh? Where do you think you're going?

option.optiontext: I’m here to help, if you need it.
What was it you needed again?
I've brought the 5 copper ingots you asked for.
Hope the soldiers are equipped well!

node.text: Ha! You? Help? Fine, prove me wrong. Bring me 5 copper ingots so the militia can forge new swords. Think you can handle that?
Well, well, looks like you can handle something simple after all. Your contribution to Haywind will be remembered!
Thanks to your help, yeah. Don’t think it means you’re special.
Oi, another one of you freeloaders? What do you want?

option.optiontext: I’m here to help, if you need anything.

node.text: You think you can help? Fine, prove it. We need 5 wool to make bandages for our wounded soldiers. You sure you're not going to mess this up?
Huh, you actually came through. The soldiers will appreciate it, even if I don’t.
Thanks to you, they’re healing up. Guess you’re not totally useless.
Oi, where do you think you're going, soldier? Don’t waste my time!

option.optiontext: I took care of the problem at the docks.

node.text: There’s some lunatic at the docks causing trouble. Think you can handle showing him the way out? Better you than one of us, just in case he’s dangerous.
Oh... well. Guess that’s handled then.
Haywind’s a bit safer thanks to you, I suppose.
Hail, traveler! What brings you to me today?

option.optiontext: I've heard you need recruits to guard the outpost from trolls. I'm willing to help.
I crafted weapons and armor for you.
How many weapons did you ask for?

node.text: To recruit, I need some weapons and armor first!

option.optiontext: What do you need? I can craft them for you.

node.text: We haven’t built an outpost yet.
You can buy a spearman for 50 coins.
I need 5 copper spears!
Thank you, traveler!
Greetings, stranger.

option.optiontext: You seem poorer than the others. Need help?
I got a fishing rod for you.

node.text: I was a fisherman, but a storm destroyed my boat and tools. I need a fishing rod to rebuild my life.
Thank you, stranger! You've given me my life back.
I recently discovered a rare type of fish, and I’m thinking of opening a marketplace for them. Can you help me?

option.optiontext: Umm... I don’t think I can help with something that big.

node.text: I'll give you 25 coins a day for your investment.
The well stinks! Why?!

option.optiontext: I think something’s stuck down there.

node.text: Can you check it out? You’ll need a rope to get it out.
The general store probably has some.
Aaaahhhh, help!

option.optiontext: What happened to you? Why do you seem... possessed?

node.text: A witch possessed me! I barely escaped. Please, go kill her so I can be free!

option.optiontext: I’ve got more important things to do.

node.text: Yes, thank you, stranger.
Hi there, Uncle! How are you?

option.optiontext: Hi, kid! What are you doing out here in the forest?
Hope your people are proud of you now!

node.text: Winter is coming, and no one’s listening to me about gathering wood. They’re scared of the trolls, so I’m gathering it myself. Can you help?
Yes, thanks to your help, Uncle!
Hi there, traveler! How are you?

option.optiontext: Where did I need to deliver the flowers?

node.text: I’m a gardener. Can you take these flowers to the general store lady and tell her they’re from me? I’m a bit shy.
Absolutely, friend.
The flowers, to the general store shopkeeper!
Ooh! Who sent them?
Oh... okay.
Yeah? How did she like them?
Hi there, stranger. Welcome to our town.

option.optiontext: Your stable looks good, but you only have two horses. Why not get more?
Is your stable at peace now?

node.text: Trolls eat everything, including my horses. If you could kill a few, I’d be thankful. Two should do.

option.optiontext: I've got more important things to do.

node.text: Yes, thank you, stranger.

Ah, hello there, traveler! Don't mind me, I'm just about to put up a pen here for my lovely sheep - very important, you know, so they don't run off and get eaten by the wolves! - just as soon as I could make any sense of these pen building instructions...

option.optiontext: You don't know how to build a sheep pen?

node.text: I'm from the big city, you see! But I picked up a book on how to become a shepherd and thought to myself, well... how hard can it be? I've never held a hammer before in my life though, I think it's needed here... say, traveler, are you any handy with tools?

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll set the pen up for you.
You're on your own, I'm afraid.

node.text: You would? Oh, you're a real hero! My sheep and I will thank you. Now, I don't know much, but I think you'll need a hammer. I've got one lying on the ground here somewhere.

Ah, traveler! You look like someone who's seen their share of hard work. My sheep have been wandering off, and wolves have been attacking them. I've been trying to build a pen to keep them safe, but I’m no builder—the instructions are a mess!

option.optiontext: I'm handy with tools, maybe I can help.
What exactly do you need me to do?

node.text: I’ve got all the parts laid out, but I just can’t figure out how to put them together. You’ll need a hammer to finish the job—I have one there on the ground. If you can get this done, I’d be in your debt.

option.optiontext: Leave it to me, I’ll have it sorted in no time.
Actually, I’m not sure I’m up for it.

node.text: I’ve got all the parts laid out, but I just can’t figure out how to put them together. You’ll need a hammer to finish the job—I have one there on the ground. If you can get this done, I’d be in your debt.

option.optiontext: Leave it to me, I’ll have it sorted in no time.
Actually, I’m not sure I’m up for it.

node.text: You’ve done it! My sheep are safe, all thanks to you, traveler. I can’t thank you enough for your help.

option.optiontext: Glad I could help. Safe travels to you and your flock.

node.text: Hello there, sir! I wonder, could you please help?

option.optiontext: What are you doing here, child? There are wolves about!

node.text: I'm not afraid of the wolves! I'm here to protect my friends against them! The bunnies, you've seen them, haven't you? They're fluffy and and always comfort me when times are hard, but the mean wolves keep hunting them!
You look like a strong knight, sir, strong enough to match the wolves! Please, won't you help me and my bunnies...? Take down a nasty pack of five wolves for us.

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll thin some of the wolf population for you...
It's just the way nature is, kid - I can't help you.

node.text: You're a brave knight, sir, I knew I could count on you! My bunnies and I thank you!
Please sir, won't you protect my bunnies? You look strong, I know you can do it!

option.optiontext: You wanted me to thin out some of the wolves?

node.text: Yes please, take out a pack of five. I know you're strong enough to do it!
You've done it! I mean, there seem to be an endless amount of wolves in these forests... but at least you took out some of them!

On behalf of the bunnies, I thank you. Um... I don't really have anything to reward you with, but here - why don't you take this wolf pelt my papa gifted me! Maybe you're someone crafty, who can make some good use of it.

option.actions: AddItems=91-1-true,SetVar=TimberwellRabbitsSaviour-5,NpcChat=If you really want to protect the rabbits> feel free to hunt down more wolves!

node.text: That stubborn man refuses to talk to me...

option.optiontext: I gave your husband a beer, like you asked.

node.text: Ugh, well... we’ve just had a slight misunderstanding between us that’s all! I’m sure we could sort it out, if he’d just stop for a second and talk to me!

option.optiontext: Well, have you tried offering him beer?

node.text: Yes! And...? What did he say?! Don't keep me waiting!

option.optiontext: Didn't say much at all, just enjoyed his beer.

node.text: No... do you think it would help? But I don't have any beer... Oh please, could you do it?

option.optiontext: Suppose I can try, if you want.
You have to solve your own problems, I'm afraid.

node.text: Ugh! What was even the point?! Thank you for trying, I guess...

option.optiontext: Your wife asked me to deliver a beer...

node.text: Hrm, cheers!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*The lumberjack gulps down the beer you offer him, then resumes work as before.*</color>

option.optiontext: Well then, suppose I let the wife know I've done as she asked...

node.text: Greetings there, traveler! Ain't it just wonderful, all these flowers? I've put in a lot of work to have them grow tall and pretty! Of course, they demand lots of care and watering... don't suppose that's something I might ask your help in?

option.optiontext: I don't have time for this.

node.text: Simply watering, friend. You see, water is quite heavy and I happened to sprain my arm carrying buckets full just the other day. Alas, my beautiful flowers can be a cruel mistress, and they demand their watering on a hot day like this, injured arm or no.

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll water your garden beds for you.
I really don't have time for this right now.

node.text: Thank you, kind friend! Usually hauling three buckets from the village well is enough to do the trick.
I've dedicated my life to perfecting my garden beds. Still, the plants can be a cruel mistress, as they require their watering even when I'm unable to carry it for them with an injured arm...

option.optiontext: You wanted me to water the plants for you?

node.text: If you would be so kind. Three buckets from our village well is usually enough to get the job done. I would be ever so grateful.
Thank you, stranger! Hopefully my arm will heal soon so my garden won't have to rely on the kindness of others for long.
I don't have much to give as payment, but I have this sack of wool I got from some of the farmers, maybe you'll find some use for it.
Ugh, these rats are driving me crazy!

option.optiontext: That should be all of them.

node.text: These rats just keep coming! Please, help me get rid of them!
Thank you, traveler!
Whack those rats!
Someone placed a strange statue on the hill, and now we’re all having nightmares! Can you destroy it? It’s up there on the hill.

option.optiontext: What do you know about this statue?
I’ve got other things to do.

node.text: Thank you, traveler!
The statue is on the hill over there. Use a pickaxe and make sure it’s completely destroyed!
Destroy the statue on the hill! Use a pickaxe and make sure it’s done properly!
The statue gives off a strange, dark energy. Some believe it’s tied to dark magic, cursing anyone who comes near. That’s why we’re all having nightmares...

option.optiontext: Dark magic, huh? I’ll be careful.

node.text: I don’t know for sure, but it must have been someone familiar with dark magic. This kind of thing has never happened here before. It’s terrifying to think someone did this on purpose.

option.optiontext: Dark magic, huh? I’ll be careful.

node.text: Oh, hello there, traveler.

option.optiontext: Do you need any help around here?
What exactly do you need me to do?
I’ve collected the three haybales. Hope that’s enough.

node.text: Well, my horse has been real stubborn today, and I’m trying to get him moving. If you could fetch three haybales for me, I’d appreciate it.
Thanks, friend! Alright, let’s get moving, horsey!
Greetings, stranger! Care to lend a hand to a wandering merchant?

option.optiontext: Hello. Do you need any help?
What was it you needed again?
I brought the items you asked for.

node.text: I’m having trouble keeping my horse steady without a proper saddle. I’ve got most of what I need, but could you fetch me 2 cowhides to finish the job? Once I have them, I can make a saddle and continue my journey safely.
You’ve saved my journey, friend! With this saddle, I’ll be able to travel safely again. Thank you!
Stranger! Be careful if you're heading near the cave... there’s a huge bear in there!

option.optiontext: What was it you needed again?

node.text: I’m a miner, but that giant bear in the cave scared the life out of me! I dropped all my gear when I ran out. Could you go in and retrieve it for me?
You found my gear! Thank you so much, I don’t know what I’d have done without it.
Here, take this pickaxe as thanks. I’m done with mining for now, so I won’t need it.
I dropped my gear when that giant bear startled me! Could you go in and retrieve it for me?
Hello there, young one.

option.optiontext: I'm a traveler looking for work, do you need anything?
I brought the groceries you asked for!

node.text: Well, since you’re offering, I could use some help. I’m not as spry as I used to be, and getting around the market is tough. Could you fetch me 2 potatoes and 2 carrots?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get them for you.
I’m a bit busy at the moment.

node.text: Thank you so much, young one! I really appreciate it.

option.optiontext: I’ve already taken care of the skeletons.

node.text: Mr. Eddie sold me this weird talisman, and when I used it, skeletons appeared inside my house! I-I didn’t mean for this to happen. Please help me!

option.optiontext: I’ve got other things to do right now.

node.text: They’re in the house! Please, you have to get rid of them all before they cause more trouble!
Thank you, thank you! You’ve saved me!
It’s been a nightmare! Here, take this staff too—I don’t want anything to do with magic anymore. I just want to go back to normal.

option.optiontext: Alright, I’ll take it off your hands.

node.text: Hey, have you seen a horse around here?

option.optiontext: Do you have any idea where it might be?

node.text: My horse ran off to the east, and I’m really worried. Those woods are said to be haunted! I don’t know what to do!

option.optiontext: I’ve got other things to take care of.

node.text: He’s nearby, but he won’t come to me! Maybe if you give him something to eat from the market, he’ll follow you?
Thank you! I can’t believe you found him!
Everything’s fine now, thanks to you.
*The horse neighs*
The horse happily eats the apple and starts following you.
Hello, stranger.

option.optiontext: I’m a traveler looking to earn some coin. Need any help with your garden?
I’ve got the 20 corn you needed.

node.text: I could definitely use a hand. If you can collect 20 corn for me, I’ll pay you for your trouble.

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get that for you.

node.text: Thank you so much!
Yes, everything’s going well, thanks to you.
I needed 20 corn to keep the harvest on track.
Ah, stranger! What brings you to the pier on this fine day?

option.optiontext: Hello! You look busy. Need any help?
Can you remind me what you needed again?
I’ve brought the berries you asked for.

node.text: Ah, you’ve caught me daydreaming about something sweet. I’ve been craving berries, but I’m tied up with work here. If you’re heading to town, could you bring me 6 red berries and 6 blue berries? It’ll make my day!

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get those for you.
I’ve got other things to take care of right now.

node.text: Thank you! These berries are exactly what I needed to brighten the day!
Fishing’s going well, and now I’ve got something sweet to keep me company, thanks to you.
Yoo-hoo, traveler! Come here!

option.optiontext: Yes? What seems to be the problem?
Could you remind me what you needed again?
I’ll be on my way now.

node.text: I need carrots for my meal! Four should be enough, don’t you think?

option.optiontext: I’ve got other things to do for now.

node.text: Thank you! You’ve saved my meal!
I don’t die that easily!
You’ve got the look of someone who’s been around. What brings you out here in the wilds?

option.optiontext: Hello! What are you up to out here?
Could you remind me of the task again?
I’ve brought the bear paw you needed.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: I’m off to meet an old friend in Haywind. We have a bit of a tradition — we exchange rare gifts, and I’m missing mine this time. I could use a bear paw to uphold my end of the deal. Could you help me out?

option.optiontext: Consider it done. I’ll bring you the paw.
I’ve got other things to handle for now.

node.text: That’s exactly what I needed! My friend will be impressed, thanks to you. I owe you one!
Greetings, traveler. You look like you can handle yourself. What brings you out here?

option.optiontext: Hello! What are you up to all the way out here?
Can you remind me of the task again?
I’ve taken care of the ten goblins you needed.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: We’re planning to attack the goblin camp over there, but those goblins look tougher than we expected. Since you look like you know your way around a fight, maybe you could weaken them a bit for us by taking out a few of them? Ten should do.

option.optiontext: I’ll take care of the goblins and weaken their camp.
I’ve got other matters to attend to for now.

node.text: Thank you, you’ve really helped us prepare for the attack!
Thanks to your help, the goblin camp is weaker, and we’re ready for the attack.
We’re still preparing to attack the goblin camp, but they’re strong. We need someone to take down 10 of them before we make our move.
Ah, traveler. What brings you to these parts of the forest?

option.optiontext: Hello! What are you doing out here in the forest?
Could you remind me what ingredients you needed again?
I've brought the forest snake skins you asked for.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: I am gathering rare ingredients for my spells and potions, but I require the skins of forest snakes to complete my rituals. Can you help me by retrieving three snake skins?

option.optiontext: I’ll gather the snake skins for you.
I’ve got other things to attend to right now.

node.text: Thank you! These skins will be perfect for my rituals.
Everything is going smoothly now, thanks to your help. My spells will be much stronger.
Ah, traveler. Welcome to our humble place.

option.optiontext: Greetings, Priestess. Do you have any work that needs doing?
Could you remind me what you needed for the meal?
I've gathered the groceries you asked for, madam.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: I am preparing a meal for the people, but I could use some help gathering ingredients. If you're willing, I need 5 Corn, 5 Carrots and 3 Redberries.

option.optiontext: Consider it done. I’ll return with what you need.
I have other matters to attend to at the moment.

node.text: Thank you, this will help greatly!

option.optiontext: Glad I could be of service.

node.text: Yes, everything is in order now, thanks to you.
Ah, traveler. What brings you this far?

option.optiontext: Hello there. What are you doing out here on the far side of Mistywood?
Could you remind me what you needed again?
I've got the axe you requested.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: I’m a woodcutter, as you can see. Came here for wood, but my axe broke, and the wild animals have me stuck. Could you bring me a new axe? A copper one will do.

option.optiontext: I’ll fetch the axe for you, no problem.
I’ve got other matters to attend to.

node.text: Thank you! This will make my work much easier.
Aye, going smooth now, thanks to you.
Ah, greetings traveler. Have you come seeking the alchemist?

option.optiontext: You've a beautiful garden here. Could you use a hand with anything?
Remind me again, what task did you need help with?
I’ve brought the water buckets you needed.
Nothing for now, just passing through. Farewell.

node.text: Ah, thank you for asking. I’m growing rare herbs for the master alchemist. If you’re willing, I could use two buckets of water from the village well, near the large tree.

option.optiontext: Consider it done. I'll return shortly.
I have other matters to attend to at the moment.

node.text: You’ve my thanks, traveler.
Yes, all is well now thanks to you.
I need help watering the garden. Could you fetch two buckets of water from the village? The well is near the big tree.

I don't need to know the details of your job, so when asked, I can honestly say I have no idea. Just know that you'll find all the tools you need here. But stay clear of Dusteny's store—he’s nothing but trouble!

option.optiontext: I'm a traveler looking for work. Can I work here?
I’ve got the package you asked for.

node.text: Actually, if you're looking for work, I could use some help. I need someone to pick up a package from the bank. Would you be interested?
Great! The package is waiting for you at the bank. Just tell them it's for me, and they'll hand it over. Come back here when you've got it.

option.optiontext: I'll head to the bank now.

node.text: Ah, you got the package! Thanks a lot.
The package is waiting for you at the bank. Just tell them it's for me, and they'll hand it over. Come back here when you've got it.

option.optiontext: I'll head to the bank now.

node.text: The streets of Thornhill can be dangerous, mate. Are you sure you’re armed well enough? I’ve got a good variety here, but I always recommend the heaviest hammer. Just bonk ‘em good, unga bunga style, y’know? Works for me.

option.optiontext: I’ve got the items you asked for.

node.text: Work, huh? Well, I don’t usually hire people, but my equipment is in bad shape. I’ve got a lot of weapons here that need repairs, but I’m out of materials. If you could bring me 5 Iron Ingots, I could fix them up and maybe even give you a cut of the profits.

option.optiontext: I’ll get those Iron Ingots for you.

node.text: I need 5 Iron Ingots to repair my stock. With those, I can get these weapons back in fighting shape. Bring them to me when you’ve got them.

option.optiontext: Maybe another time, I’ve got to go.

node.text: Thanks a lot! I can finally repair my weapons and get back to business.
Aaahhh, help! That thief just ran off with my goods! I’ll be ruined!
That thief stole from me and bolted behind that building! Please, you’ve got to stop him before he gets away!
You caught him? Thank you so much! I don’t know what I’d have done if I lost those goods.
Yes? State your business.
Work for you? Hah! We only do serious work here!

option.optiontext: Come on, I can handle it!
What do you mean by 'serious' work?

node.text: Alright, maybe. How about a sparring match? Let’s see if you can back up that confidence. Think you’re ready?
Bwahahaha! You thought you could handle it? You barely stood a chance! That was hilarious!
Not bad at all! You’ve done a great job, and our guys needed a bit of fun for a change. We’ll keep an eye on you.
Hey, you! Heading east?
Good. Escort this man to the east gate. I don’t have time for this. Get him there, a colleague of mine will meet you outside the gate.
You’re supposed to escort that man to the east gate. Don’t make me repeat myself.

option.optiontext: Got it. I’ll take care of it.

node.text: Is this the man?
Good. I’ll take it from here. You’re done.
Hey, traveler. What do you want?

option.optiontext: Just looking for some work. Need a hand?
Can you remind me of the task?

node.text: Work? Hmph. You don't look like you can handle yourself against much. But, if you're serious, I’ve got a pack of bears causing trouble to the east. Think you can handle killing six of them? Don’t go getting yourself mauled.

option.optiontext: I can handle it. I’ll take care of them.
Maybe not. I’ll be on my way.

node.text: You actually did it? I have to admit, I didn’t think you could. Alright, now I can report back without looking like an idiot. Good work.
You’re supposed to kill six bears. That’s if you think you can handle it, of course.
Alright, if you’re sure. Here, take this crossbow. It’ll help you bring those bears down. Don’t say I didn’t warn you.
Hey there, traveler! Got a second?

option.optiontext: Hi, just walking around. Need something?
Can you remind me of the task?
I’ve brought the items you asked for.
How are your alchemy lessons going?

node.text: Yeah, I’m trying to practice medicine making, but I’m short on ingredients. Have you come across any dandelions? I need about 10 of them.

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll keep an eye out.

node.text: Oh great, you found the dandelions! Thanks a bunch, this will really help with my studies.
The lessons are going fine. Thanks again for the dandelions, they’ve been a big help!
Hey traveler, do you work around here?

option.optiontext: Not really, but I can help. What do you need?
What was it you needed again?
I’ve brought the items you asked for.

node.text: I need 3 ropes to secure the cargo before we set sail, but the crew’s all over the place. Could you grab them from the loading area?
Thanks a lot! That’ll make things much easier for us.
I still need those 3 ropes. You’ll find them in the loading area with the rest of the cargo.
Hey traveler, are you part of the Preservation Society too? Could you give me a hand?

option.optiontext: Remind me, what did you need again?
I’ve got the hammer you asked for.

node.text: I’m working on fixing up this old sign, but I need a hammer to finish the job. Could you grab one for me from the general store?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get it for you.

node.text: Ah, perfect! Thanks, I really appreciate it.
Everything’s going smoothly now, thanks to your help!.
Rats!! Can you see them? They're everywhere, tearing up my fields! We need to get rid of them before they ruin everything!

option.optiontext: I see them! Let me help you out.
I’ve already taken care of the rats.

node.text: That’d be great! We’ve got to get rid of these rats before they eat everything. They’re everywhere in the field!

option.optiontext: I’m on it, I’ll take care of the rats.

node.text: Thanks a lot! You’ve done a huge favor by getting rid of those rats!
The fields are looking so much better now, thanks to your help!
Rats are tearing up our fields! We’ve got to get rid of them before it’s too late!
Shoo! Shoo! Get out of here, you pesky crows!

option.optiontext: I’ve got the materials for the scarecrows.
What do you need for the scarecrows again?

node.text: That's an excellent idea! Can you find some haybales? Three should do it, I have the rest of the materials.
Thanks! That’s a big help. These scarecrows will keep those crows away!
The scarecrows are working perfectly now, thanks to you!
I just need the materials, three haybales should do it. Can you help me collect them? I’ll build it myself after.
Traveler, can you see those people lurking over there? Are they dangerous?

option.optiontext: What did you need me to do again?

node.text: The outlaws! They’re hiding in the woods and sneaking into the fields at night to steal my sheep. I’m afraid they’ll be back.

option.optiontext: I’ll take care of them for you.

node.text: Thank you so much! You’ve really saved me and my flock.
For now, yes, but they always seem to return after a while.

option.optiontext: Let me know if they come back.

node.text: Hello traveler, what brings you out this way?

option.optiontext: I’m just a traveler looking for work. Need a hand?

node.text: Actually, I could use some help. I’m stuck on duty and can’t leave the post, but I could really use a beer from the tavern near the scrap yard to the south. Could you fetch one for me?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get it for you.

node.text: Ah, thanks a lot! I really needed that.
Yes, everything’s secure now, thanks to you.
Ugh, these blasted mosquitoes! How do you manage to deal with them? They're driving me mad, and I can't even get to Fenwater!

option.optiontext: Remind me, what was the task again?
Is it safe from the mosquitoes now?

node.text: Fight them off? You make it sound easy! I can't take it anymore. Could you kill five of those pests for me? It would help me a lot.

option.optiontext: Alright, I’ll take care of them.
I’ve had enough of mosquitoes too.

node.text: Thank you! Finally, I can get to Fenwater without getting eaten alive by mosquitoes.
No more mosquitoes, thanks to you! I can finally head to Fenwater in peace.
Did you bring a weapon? Those tentacles… they got me good.

option.optiontext: Remind me, what was the task?

node.text: I tried to fight them off, but they got the better of me. I can’t get past them in this state. Can you take care of them for me?
Thanks a lot! I wouldn’t have made it without your help.
You there, traveler! These lizards have been getting more aggressive lately. Could use some help scaring them off.

option.optiontext: I’m looking for work. What do you need?
I’ve taken care of the lizards.
Can you remind me what you needed again?

node.text: The swamp’s full of them, acting more aggressive than usual. If you could head over and kill five of the lizards, it might scare the rest away.
Thanks! That should calm them down a bit.
The lizards have calmed down, thanks to you. I appreciate it.
Hey traveler, got a moment? I could really use some help...

option.optiontext: What happened? Are you mining here?

node.text: I... I fell into a cave while mining. Barely got out, but I dropped my health potion down there. It’s dangerous, and I’m not going back without it. Can you grab it for me so I can make my way back to town?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get it for you.

node.text: Thanks, you’re a lifesaver! I don’t think I could have made it back without you.
Yes, thanks to you, I can finally get out of here.
Hey, you look like someone who knows their way around a fishing rod. Care to help a fellow out?

option.optiontext: Yeah, I can fish. What do you need?
I’ve caught the fish you wanted.
Can you remind me what you needed again?

node.text: It’s been tough out here lately. The reed bass aren’t biting, and I need to feed my family. Could you catch 2 for me?

option.optiontext: I’ll get those fish for you.

node.text: You did it! This is going to make a huge difference for me and my family. Thank you!
Thanks to you, I’m finally catching something decent again.
Hey, are you heading inside? Please, could you help me?

option.optiontext: What’s wrong? You don’t look well.
I’ve got the salve you needed.
Remind me, what was the task again?

node.text: I was bitten by mosquitoes, and I feel terrible. I made it here, but I need medicine. The witch has a salve that could help, but I’m too scared to go myself. Can you get it for me?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll get it for you.

node.text: Thank you so much! I really appreciate it.
Yes, I’m feeling much better now, thanks to you!
I got bitten by mosquitoes and made it here, but I need medicine. I’m too scared to visit the witch myself. Could you get some salve from her for me?

option.optiontext: Got it. I’ll get it for you.

node.text: Hey traveler, you look like you can handle yourself.

option.optiontext: Do you know where the thief is?

node.text: I’m a guard from Haywind, and I was sent to catch a thief, but he’s way too strong for me. If you find him and take him out, the people of Aurfield will be safe. Just remember, you’ll need to fight him in melee.
He’s been breaking into houses, so you should be able to find him in one of them. Take him out, and I’ll head back to Haywind.
Hello traveler, what brings you here?

option.optiontext: What are you doing out here?
Your caravan was looted by bandits, but I found 15 iron ingots. Do you still want them?
I hope your master is okay with what’s left of the caravan.

node.text: I’m a merchant’s assistant, waiting for my master’s caravan to arrive. It’s full of iron ingots and very important, but it’s late. Could you check if it’s lost out in the wilderness?
Please hand over whatever you managed to find.
Yes, thank you. At least someone’s helping.
Hello traveler, what brings you here?

option.optiontext: I brought the materials you asked for.
Remind me, what was the task again?

node.text: I’m trying to renovate my house and need some materials—5 planks and 5 nails.
Great, please hand over the materials.
Yes, thank you. At least someone’s helping.

Oh, perfact! I’m completely swamped with orders and, would you believe it, I’ve run out of wood! A furniture merchant without wood—how embarrassing, right? I don’t have time to go fetch more. Could you bring me 5 spruce logs so I can keep working?

option.optiontext: Sure, I can help with that!

node.text: Thank you so much! Guess I won’t be the woodless furniture merchant anymore!
Ahoy there, stranger! What brings you to the water today?

option.optiontext: I’m looking to buy some fish for a meal. Got anything?
I’m heading back to town, need anything?
Remind me what you needed again?

node.text: I’m starving! Could you grab me something to eat from the market?

option.optiontext: I can’t do that right now.

node.text: Wonderful, thank you!
Some chicken legs would be perfect. There’s a meat stand at the market.
I don’t have any coin, but please take this book. It’s a good read!
Please... please don't hurt me!
Oh... thank heavens, you're not him! My name is Elowen and I'm a wealthy merchant. On my way here from the north, I picked up a nasty looking man tailing me.

I rushed the rest of the way here as fast as I could, but that nasty man kept up with me! Now he's waiting outside the bank for me to come out! I've been trying to get someone to take me seriously - to help me - but so far everyone's laughed and called me paranoid! Please, there's a few coins in it for you...

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll confront the man for you.
I can't help you, I'm sorry.

node.text: Thank you, oh thank you! He's waiting just outside the bank, with a nasty scar on his face, and a nasty dagger in hand...
Well...? Did you confront him, ask him what he wanted? Please, I'm at my wit's end here...

option.optiontext: The ruffian will trouble you no more.
Sorry, who are you talking about again?

node.text: Why, the ruffian outside this very bank! He tailed me here for a good length of the road, despite that I tried to keep up good pace! Now I'm afraid of leaving the bank with him standing out there, waiting...
You've saved me, hero! I did not lie when I said I'm a wealthy merchant - traveling these backwater lands, I know - hah! But it's true, and I'm more than happy to compensate those who come to my aid.
Please accept this gift of 500 coins! I'm sure that bandit would've extorted much more out of me, given the chance. As far as I'm concerned, you're worth every penny!

option.actions: AddItems=131-500-true,SetVar=FriendOfFenwaterTownWelfareBandit-3,NpcChat=Thank you for keeping me safe> stranger!

node.text: I've got no business with you, bugger off!

option.optiontext: A man in the bank says you're bothering him.

node.text: Nonsense! And so what if I am, what's it to you?

option.optiontext: He's paying me gold to make you leave, so time to clear off.

node.text: Ah, hells! Always some do-gooder's gotta come along and try to ruin everything! Well I mean to take that soft, plump merchant's gold for myself, and you ain't gonna stand in the way of that!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*The ruffian charges at you with his knife drawn!*</color>
Well, hello there, young one. What brings you to Fenwater today?

option.optiontext: I’m looking for some quality lumber for a project. Can you help?
Do you need any help around here?
Can you remind me of the task?

node.text: I was teaching my boy to chop wood, but he ran off toward the west. I'm getting worried. Could you check on him for me?
Oh, good! So, is he coming back home?

option.optiontext: Actually, he wants to become a miner.

node.text: Oh, hello there!

option.optiontext: Your father’s worried. You should go home.

node.text: I’m fine, really. I don’t want to chop wood. I want to be a miner!
This book on rocks is fascinating. You should check it out!
Nooooooo!! He wants to leave the family trade?!
Hey there, stranger!

option.optiontext: Hi! It's filthy here, need a hand?

node.text: Yes! Trash is everywhere, and it stinks if you walk past it! Could you help me pick up some of it?
Thank you so much!
Please help me clean up this trash!
Greetings, stranger! What brings you to my farm today?

option.optiontext: I’m looking for fresh produce. Do you have any for sale?
I heard the village needs help distributing food!

node.text: Yes, we need someone to harvest ten potatoes this season before they spoil.
Thanks, stranger! Now the villagers will have enough food!
Yes, thanks to your help!
Potatoes, innit? Five potatoes!
Greetings, traveler! What can I forge for you today?

option.optiontext: I need a new weapon. Do you have something for me?
Do you need help? I’m looking for work.
Remind me, what was the task again?

node.text: Thank you! This coal will really help the village.
Yes, I could use some help gathering coal. It’s essential for crafting the tools the village needs.

option.optiontext: I’ll get some coal for you.

node.text: You’ll find coal in the quarry to the south. It’s a bit of a trek, but that’s where we get the best coal. Please bring me five pieces of coal.

option.optiontext: Alright, I’ll mine some coal for you.

node.text: I asked you to gather five pieces of coal. The quarry to the south is where you can find them.

option.optiontext: Got it, I’ll get on it.

node.text: Greetings, traveler! What brings you to my farm today?

option.optiontext: I’m looking for fresh produce. Do you have any for sale?
Your farm seems to have a pest problem. Need my help?
Can you remind me what you needed again?

node.text: You any good at dealing with 'em? They’re all over the fields, ruining everything!
Well done! Thanks, stranger. My chickens will have quite the feast with those dead frogs.
Yes, thank you!
I need someone to get rid of the frogs in my fields. They’re causing all sorts of trouble!
Hey, what do you need?

option.optiontext: I need some sturdy furniture. Can you make something for me?
What's going on with that pile of wood?
Wait, what was the task again?
Is the cart holding up now?

node.text: I’m trying to build a cart, but it keeps falling apart!
Nah, I’m using glue from the apothecary. It’s supposed to be good stuff!

option.optiontext: Maybe you should try using nails instead?

node.text: Awesome! You got the nails! Let’s get building!
Wow, it’s looking great!
Maybe... It’s worth a shot. There’s a general store down the hill. Could you grab some nails?

option.optiontext: I’ll be right back. And no more glue!

node.text: Greetings, weary traveler! How can I assist you today?

option.optiontext: I’m in need of some potions. Do you have any for sale?
I’m looking for work. Do you need any help around here?
I brought the herbs you asked for!
Can you remind me of the task again?

node.text: Actually, I could use a hand! I need 3 sweetgrass for my potions, and they grow on the east side of Fenwater. Could you gather some for me?

option.optiontext: I’ll gather them and bring them to you.

node.text: Wonderful! These will do perfectly. Thank you so much.
I still need those 3 sweetgrass herbs. You can find them on the east side of Fenwater village.
I studied to become a doctor at the Haywind college, but found it too demanding, so I chose bartending here instead. Now I find my bartending duties aren't quite as relaxed as I had thought either...
You wouldn't believe it, our village simply has the thirstiest folks in all the realm - the ale flows non-stop!

option.optiontext: Isn't that a good thing, for you I mean?

node.text: Sure that's good for business, but I find us constantly running out of beer! I was expecting a shipment right now, as a matter of fact, but I just got word some ruffians up the road north seized it for themselves...
You would? I'd be most appreciative! Like I said, the ruffians are camping just up the road north. I just hope they haven't drunk the whole shipment yet...
Hey there, again! Say, wouldn't be the case you had any luck finding my misplaced beer shipment? If I don't get it soon, we'll be getting in slight bit of trouble with the customers upstairs.

option.optiontext: Where did you say your shipment went missing?

node.text: I got word there are ruffians camping just up the road towards north, who grabbed the beer for themselves. I only hope they didn't manage to drink through all of it yet...

option.optiontext: I'll see what I can do.

node.text: Hey there, friend! Say, do my eyes betray me, or is that my misplaced beer shipment you're hauling back to me?

option.optiontext: I *was* hauling it, but where did I leave it...?

node.text: It may not seem like it, but you've saved my life here! Well, at least for now. Knowing these folk, I'll be needing a fresh shipment of beer soon enough.

But nevermind that! Here's a few coins for your aid, friend, oh and... not much stuck from my doctor's studies in the city, but I do have a special pain numbing brew for you - may it ease the way on your journeys!

option.actions: SetVar=GrainwaterBeerA-3,RemoveItems=1892-1,AddItems=131-25-true|806-1-true,NpcChat=Wonder how long this beer will last with the folk upstairs...

node.text: Greetings, traveler! How can I assist you today?

option.optiontext: I’m a traveler looking for work. Need any help?
I’ve brought you the barley you requested.
I hope business is doing well!
Just stopping by to say hello.
Remind me, what was it you needed again?

node.text: Actually, yes! I need five fresh barley to brew a special batch of beer. If you could gather that for me, it’d be a great help.

option.optiontext: Best of luck with the brewing!

node.text: You’ve done me a great favor, traveler! Thank you for bringing the barley.
Hey there, traveler! Looking for some lumber or help?

option.optiontext: I’m a traveler searching for work. Do you need any assistance?
I’ve brought the spruce logs you requested.

node.text: I could really use help gathering ten spruce logs. Think you’re up for the task?

option.optiontext: Sure, I’ll gather them for you!

node.text: Thanks a lot for the logs, traveler! This will really help with the workload.
Would you like to buy some fresh, homegrown vegetables?

option.optiontext: I’ve got some mail for you!

node.text: Around here, we say 'innit'! But yes, it is. Can I interest you in some vegetables?
Oh! A letter? That’s great! Thanks a lot, traveler!
Fresh meats for sale, traveler! What can I get for you?

option.optiontext: Yes, I’d like to buy some!
Your shop looks a little empty. Need any help stocking up?
Remind me, what did you need again?
I’ve brought the chickens you asked for.

node.text: Actually, yes! I could use five raw chickens to restock. You can find some to the southeast of the market. I’m sure no one will notice if a few go missing, hehe.
Thank you for the chickens, traveler! You’ve really helped me out.
I still need five raw chickens from the southeast of here, outside the market. Don’t worry, no one will miss a few!
<color=#9C8C77>*The lumberjack regards you, panting heavily and seeming exhausted.*</color>\n\nHello there, outlander... Welcome to our village... Enjoy the festival... and so and such...

Just came out of the woods... brought this load of firewood to help keep the village hearths burning... got ambushed by goblins on the way though, had to run for my life, but also... wouldn't leave the wood behind...
Wood still needs to be distributed within the village but... must say... I'm spent... could use some help if I'm honest...

option.optiontext: No trouble, I can deliver the wood for you.

node.text: You're a lifesaver...! The people expecting deliveries are just down the main street... The village hall, the tailor, the blacksmith... Talk to the maids... here, I'll help you unload some of the wood...
Hello again... Villagers really waiting for their firewood, but... I'm still spent from my ordeal in the forest... Could really use some help delivering the wood to the folks...

option.optiontext: Right, you asked me to help deliver firewood?
Struggling to remember where I had to make the deliveries.
Seem to have lost some firewood on the way...

node.text: Aye... would do it myself but... am a bit exhausted, after those nasty goblins ambushed me in the woods... had to run for my life, while hauling all this wood...

option.optiontext: Struggling to remember where I had to make the deliveries.
Seem to have lost some firewood on the way...
No problem, I'll see it done.

node.text: The people expecting deliveries are just down the main street... The village hall, the tailor, the blacksmith... Talk to the maids... Shouldn't be hard to find, if I'm honest... It's a small village...

option.optiontext: Right, you asked me to help deliver firewood?
Seem to have lost some firewood on the way...
No problem, I'll see it done.

node.text: No problem... happens... there's plenty more where that came from...
Welcome to the village hall, friend! I'm afraid I'm quite busy, for I'm expecting a firewood delivery from a lumberjack.

option.optiontext: That's why I'm here, actually - I have your firewood.

node.text: Oh, what a welcome surprise then. Perfect, thank you so much!
Hello, sir, this is the tailor's house.

option.optiontext: I have a delivery of firewood.

node.text: Oh, how thoughtful of you! You've clearly caught the festival spirit, thank you so much! Remember, festival tokens come to those who do good deeds!
Oh, hello? This is the blacksmith's workshop, but master blacksmith is outside just now, if you wish to do business with him.

option.optiontext: Actually, I'm here for you - delivering firewood.

node.text: But... you're not the lumberjack Bjorn... with his strong, muscular arms and... ahem... I was waiting for Bjorn. He was supposed to deliver the wood.

option.optiontext: What can I say, he's indisposed.

node.text: Ugh, but... you don't understand, I had everything prepared for him and... it's just that it was meant to be him! Now you've ruined the festival for me, everything's ruined! Fine, just give me the firewood and go!

option.optiontext: Okay, err, glad I could help.

node.text: Ah, greetings. I am a master sculptor - truly one of the finest in my field. They’ve asked me to display my art here at the winter festival, though I doubt most people can even appreciate true artistry. Still, would you like to try your hand at ice sculpting? It’s not for the faint of heart.

option.optiontext: Sure, I'm good with my hands.
No thanks, I'll just admire from afar.

node.text: Ah, a bold statement. But tell me, did you at least have the foresight to bring a miner’s chisel and hammer? Without them, you’re as helpless as a bird without wings.

option.optiontext: Of course, what do you take me for?

node.text: Well good, I had to ask. Lined up next to me you will find plain ice blocks. Try starting with the smallest one, no need to embarrass yourself attempting anything ambitious. Sculpting is an art only few can master, after all.
What? You don’t have a miner’s chisel? Surely a craftsman has been trained in mining and received one from their trainer? Or did you foolishly neglect that essential part of your education?

option.optiontext: Oh shush, I must have one somewhere...

node.text: How is your sculpting coming along? Not that I expect much - it takes a lifetime to achieve true brilliance, after all.

option.optiontext: Could you remind me how to get started?

node.text: Well, the ice blocks are lined up right next to me - astonishing that you should have forgotten already. Equip a hammer and use the miner’s chisel you should have acquired from a mining trainer. Do try not to ruin the ice, I so hate having to look for new blocks of ice.
Hey there, mister! Say, are you any good at making snowballs? My friends and I, we erm... want to play with snowballs. We sure love snow!

option.optiontext: How sweet, suppose I can try to help.

node.text: Thanks! Oh, wait... are you any good at magic by chance? See, the snowballs we make are quite soft and keep falling apart. But if you were to cast some kind of an ice spell on it, maybe it'd become super solid!

option.optiontext: After all, why not? Hand it over then.
Sorry, kid, magic's not my strong suit.

node.text: Alright, here you go, sir! It's just a regular, soft snowball now, but with magic I bet you can make it very strong!
Hey there, mister! How's it going, did you manage to make an exceptionally durable snowball for us?

option.optiontext: Oh yes, here you go, children - knock yourselves out! Er, not literally though...
I need another snowball, I lost the first one.

node.text: Oh, no problem, mister! Here’s another one - try not to lose it again!
Oohooo! That's very kind of you, mister - thank you! I can tell you, with a snowball this hard, we are going to have so much fun...!
Oh, hello there! You have a nice, friendly face. I can always tell who the friendly types are, and you are definitely friendly! Isn't that so?

Why, yes, actually! How nice of you to ask! You see, it's a festive season here in Evergreen Hearth and I want to take the opportunity to tell my husband just how much I love him! So I've gift wrapped a package for him, oh isn't that just so sweet?

But my husband is working at the lumberyard out in the wilderness, even with the festivities going on, can you imagine?! Oh he's so busy all the time, always working... Anyway, would you be so kind as to deliver my package for him, please?

Thank you so much! I knew you had such a kind face about you! The lumberyard is a bit of a walk from here, in the woods east just outside the village. He’s usually there, chopping wood with his friends.
Hello again! I remember your kind face, I asked you to deliver my lovely, gift wrapped package to my hard working husband, did I not?

option.optiontext: Hmm, are you sure you gave me the package?
Remind me, where do I need to go?

node.text: The lumberyard is a bit of a walk from here, in the woods east just outside the village. He’s usually there, chopping wood with his friends, the busy man that he is.

option.optiontext: Hmm, are you sure you gave me the package?

node.text: Oh dear, I have it right here! I don't understand how this could've happened, I could almost swear I handed it to you! Oh well, these things happen, haha! Please, take it to my husband.

option.optiontext: Remind me, where do I need to go?

node.text: Yes, hello? I don't think I recognize you from the village. Wait... you were sent by my wife, weren't you?

option.optiontext: I was, actually - she asked me to deliver this gift to you!

node.text: Oh, lovely... real lovely... isn't that just lovely?! Yet another package! Oooh, I wonder, what is it this time? What lovely gift has she thought up for his lovely husband, eh?!
You think she what, sent a gift for me? Is that how she roped you into this? That manipulative witch, the only gifts she gives are to herself!

option.optiontext: Er... if you'd just take the package...

node.text: And what, you think I spend all my hours out here away from the village because I like it?! This way, I don't have to be anywhere near her!

Out here a man can freeze where he stands, and is constantly ambushed by wolves and goblins! Yet I spend even the nights out here, staring at the stars... relishing at the peace and quiet, only the sound of trees to comfort me...

option.optiontext: Can we wrap this up? No pun intended...
Could try talking to your wife...?

node.text: It’s freedom, that's what it is! Freedom from her constant schemes and manipulation. Freedom, such as I only may be afforded...

option.optiontext: I'm beginning to wish I was free...

node.text: I'll say, she may keep her packages and games! I'm done with them - I won't have it!

option.optiontext: Please, I can't take it back to her either...

node.text: Keep it then, but I'm not having it! I don’t care what’s in it, I don't want it. I'm drawing a line in the sand, or snow, or something! Good day!
Ah, yes... I sense a curious soul approaches. Do you seek a glimpse into your future, prudent one?

option.optiontext: Yes, why not? I’d like to hear a prophecy.
No thanks, I’m not into that.

node.text: Very well, I will need but a moment to summon my powers... Let us see what the threads of fate reveal...
Oh, my... oh, oh no! But alas, the signs are clear, there is no question about it - you are in grave danger!
Yeeess... A shadow follows you, a curse cast from the dark. If it is not stopped, it will bring ruin!

option.optiontext: Do you know of a way to stop it?

node.text: Yeeeess, yeeess, there is a way... You must hunt for three mighty talismans, each held by a dangerous and a powerful foe.

Out in the wilderness, there are three goblin camps. Each camp holds a leader, and each leader holds a talisman of shamanic powers. You must retrieve all three, for only their power united may guard your spirit!
Indeed, there is no other way, if you wish to save yourself. Once you have all three, return to me. I will perform a ritual to protect you from the shadow.

Ah yes, you return... I asked you to delve into the crypts, and... no, wait... yes, I see now - you are the one, who must hunt for three talismans of shamanic powers, for it is the only way to protect yourself against the shadow.

option.optiontext: Remind me, where do I look for these protective talismans?
Yes, I shall look into it.

node.text: Out in the wilderness, there are three goblin camps. Each camp holds a leader, and each leader holds a talisman of shamanic powers. You must retrieve all three, for only their power united may guard your spirit!

option.optiontext: Actually, I already have the talismans.

node.text: Very good... very good! Hand them over, for these talismans will allow me to perform a protective ritual only I can do. Your spirit is at stake!

<color=#9C8C77>*The seer moves her hands in strange patterns over the talismans, while chanting words that in all fairness sound like complete gibberish. She finishes raising her hand to a dramatic effect, though nothing else of noteworthy seems to happen.*</color>
It took much out of me, but the ritual is complete... You are now protected against the shadow that looms over you. Remain cautious, but fear no more.

option.optiontext: Ah, thank you, oh wise one.

node.text: Ah, another traveler! We have many during our traditional Hearthlight Festival, despite our remote location. Welcome to our humble village hall! How may I help you?

option.optiontext: Perhaps it's the other way around, how may I help you?

node.text: Oh, all help is certainly appreciated during this busy season! We like to reward such deeds with festival tokens, which may be traded for village goods. Hmm, let's see...

I've sent men out into the woods to gather supplies for festival preparations, but they have been gone for a while and I worry. The woods aren't as safe as they used to be. If you're heading out there, would you look for them?

option.optiontext: That's a little beyond my scope, I'm afraid.

node.text: The men I'm expecting to hear from are a lumberjack far in the forest to the north, a fisherman at the frozen lake, and the miners working at the Coldstone quarry beyond the lake to the east.

option.optiontext: Very well, I'll look for them.
That sounds a little too much for me, sorry.

node.text: Excellent! I trust they're fine, they're all hardened men after all, but please return the supplies they've gathered here to me. I'm sure it'll ease their burden and nudge our festival preparations along.
Ah, outlander! How goes your search for my men in the woods?

option.optiontext: I return from the woods, with the supplies you requested.
Remind me, where should I be looking for your men?

node.text: The men I'm expecting to hear from are a lumberjack far in the forest to the north, a fisherman at the frozen lake, and the miners working at the Coldstone quarry beyond the lake to the east.
Simply wonderful! I had been waiting for these supplies for some time. Thank you for your hard work, outlander! Carry on, and our village will greatly reward you with our festival tokens!
Hello there, adventurer! What brings you to these far reaches of the woods?

option.optiontext: The steward back at the village sent me to check up on your progress.

node.text: Ah, an impatient man, as ever! Well, if it's wood he's waiting on, we've got some to send back to him. Here you go!
O'ho, adventurer! What brings you out to this frozen lake?

option.optiontext: The steward back at the village sent me to check up on your progress.

node.text: Ah, did he now? Perfect timing, as it happens! Was waiting for the fish to bite all day, and just before you arrive, I caught a few! Here, the steward will be pleased.
Is someone there?! Ancestors, it's dark out here! Weren't expecting anyone come to the quarry.

option.optiontext: The steward back at the village sent me to check up on your progress.

node.text: Yes, right, I see. Well we're not fully loaded yet, but we can give you what we've got to deliver back to the steward.
And now a traveler arrives to witness this?! Oh the travesty, the disgrace! I'll be the laughing stock among all the mayors of the realm, I can already hear them snicker...!

option.optiontext: What exactly is the problem you're having?

node.text: Why, isn't it obvious? This fool lying on the ground is the epitome of what's wrong with my village! The people of Grainwater are too eager of revelers, and this is what it leads to - public displays of utmost decadence!

option.optiontext: Well, can't anything be done about it?

node.text: Alas, my own villagers defy me, they laugh at my plight and carry on with their indulgent ways! But perhaps an outsider like you could be what I need to clean my streets?

option.optiontext: What would you have me do?
Sorry, but I'll want to part in this.

node.text: I've been trying to shout at these drunkards to vacate the streets but to no avail. More drastic measures are needed... Perhaps you could acquire cold, fresh water from the well and pour it on these fools?
That if anything ought to clear their heads and help bring them back to their senses. I think I've seen three wastrels lying about somewhere, please see to all of them.

option.actions: SetVar=Drunks_of_Grainwater-1,NpcChat=Cold> fresh water from the well ought to clear their heads.

node.text: Please, good sir, aid me in my plight! Help me clean these indulgent wastrels off my streets. They are an embarrassment to both my village and myself!

option.optiontext: Remind me, what did you ask of me?

node.text: I've been trying to shout at these drunkards to vacate the streets but to no avail. More drastic measures are needed... Perhaps you could acquire cold, fresh water from the well and pour it on these fools?
That if anything ought to clear their heads and help bring them back to their senses. I think I've seen three wastrels lying about somewhere, please see to all of them.
A valiant effort, my man! The village drunks are persistent in their ways, but at least you've given them an awakening!
As we're a humble folk, I have no coin to offer you... But here, please accept our local delicacies for your efforts!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Gain 3 beer and 3 grainwater flatbread!*</color>

option.actions: AddItems=1011-3-true|296-3-true,SetVar=Drunks_of_Grainwater-3,NpcChat=If you have any questions about our village> I'm happy to oblige.

node.text: You have my gratitude for your valiant effort to clean up our community. The village drunks remain persistent in their ways, but at least you gave them an awakening!

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about your village?

node.text: Here in Grainwater we care not for the worries of the realm. We enjoy peaceful lives, full of merrymaking and festivities, and we're far better at it than those pretentious fools at Little Grainwater across the water! Say, have you visited our tavern?

You won't experience better anywhere! Amelia offers the finest beer and her kitchen's unmatched also! But most remarkably, she's found a very real flute gnome to perform day and night - a flute gnome, can you imagine?!

option.optiontext: What was that about Little Grainwater?

node.text: Oh, nothing! Our sister village, Little Grainwater, lies just across the river. Their foolish Mayor is always trying to match what we do here, it's quite sad really.
I heard he'd recently set up some kind of a festival, hah! Nothing worth seeing, I'm sure - I can't imagine they have anything set up that we didn't already have this side of the river.
I don't even know! Who found him, and where?! It remains an unsolved mystery, but what we do know is that he's called Tom and he plays ceaselessly at our tavern. Well, my people have no objections!

option.optiontext: What was that about Little Grainwater?
